subject: Re: A shipment from order #SSN1566 is on the way

conversations.body_text: Hi Alyk,    Please open the "Vibration Feedback" interface in SIMSONN MANAGER 2.0.8 and check if the power indicator is green. A green icon means the power is successfully connected. You can test the vibration function directly on this screen.  If the device is not shown as connected, try reconnecting the USB and power cables. Make sure to plug in the USB first, then the power, to ensure proper initialization.     Please make sure you are using SimHub version 9.9.3 to ensure full compatibility and feature support.

Hey I got them working. The effects can get stuck on though. Like say the
gear shift happens. The clutch will keep vibrating until the next gear
shift sometimes.

On Sat, Jul 5, 2025, 10:13 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Alyk,    Please update the software to version 2.0.9 in the settings, then update the pedal firmware and run a test. You can also use SIMHUB 9.9.3 for telemetry testing.  Additionally, if you're using a Fanatec or Moza wheelbase and your PC power plug is a 2-prong (non-grounded) type, there may be electromagnetic interference issues. Here’s how to resolve it:    Ensure the PC or wheelbase is properly grounded via a household ground line;    Use a green shielding wire to connect the control box to any metal part of the pedal (make sure the contact point is free of paint);    Consider using a USB isolator to reduce interference from the power supply or wheelbase;    If the issue persists, connect the wheelbase housing to the PC case using a wire to improve grounding.

I did all this and am still having the same issue where an effect gets
stuck on

On Sat, Jul 19, 2025 at 2:23 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Alyk,  Please send us a screenshot of the software interface so we can verify your software and hardware versions. If the device is stuck or unresponsive, you may also provide a video to help illustrate the issue. Additionally, please ensure the USB is connected directly to a blue USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC. Do not use a USB hub, as it may cause unstable power supply issues.   If you're using a ProX unit, please update the firmware to the latest version.   Please go to Settings → Update and click Update to upgrade the software to version 2.0.9. Then, in the same interface, click Manual Firmware Update, navigate to the pedals-firmware folder → pedals folder, and select the prox.sfu file to update the firmware. Once the update is complete, please run the test again.

I am fully updated and grounded. I had better luck with the old firmware
actually.

On Mon, Jul 21, 2025 at 9:54 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Alyk,  Has the issue with your ProX paired with the VAM Pro been resolved?

No. the feedback still gets stuck. with the old firmware it was only half
the time. now it's everytime i try to run them. i'll wait for another
update and see what happens

On Sat, Aug 9, 2025 at 10:34 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Alyk, Please provide your pedal model and order number, along with photos of the overall pedal installation, the VAM Pro installation position, and your wheel base. I will check them for you first, and I will also run a test on my side tomorrow.          1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding.     2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive.     3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup.     4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.     5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.     6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference.     7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements.     8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.        https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LciAFDFWJ1w   ​

Hello,

I see you are coming out with new VAMs, when mine still get stuck on.It's
fully grounded. I have not been able to use them since i bought them
because of this.

Can you send me a new setup and I can ship mine back?


Thanks,
Alyk
Hi Alyk,  please take a photo of the grounding connections between the PC case, the main control box, and the pedals. I will help you check the issue and provide a solution.
On Sat, Dec 6, 2025, 12:07 AM service@simsonn.com

I also have a ground tester, and everything checks out as grounded to the
simsonn box

Hi Alyk,  Please uninstall the old version of SIMSONN Manager from your computer, then download and install the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2. Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals and select the firmware for your pedal model (proxultra.sfu for ProX Ultra, or prox.sfu for other models). After updating, the firmware should display CPU1: 2.0.5 and CPU2: 2.0.4. Please retest the pedal after the update.      https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

Still gets stuck. Lasted 15 min until an effect gets stuck on and i have to
unplug the power to shut it off.

On Sat, Dec 13, 2025 at 9:54 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Alyk, The image is not fully displayed. The most important point is to connect a wire from the computer case to any small screw on the controller, which can resolve the interrupt signal issue. Additionally, please use the blue USB 3.0 port at the back of the computer and avoid using a USB hub.

I've had it connected. And pictured is the ground tester. Everything is
grounded. Plugged into us. 3.1 in the back

On Sat, Dec 20, 2025, 6:57 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Alyk,      Please provide your order number, contact name, phone number, and shipping address, and we will send you a replacement control box.

ORDER# SSN1566 (haptic motor order#)
ORDER# SSN2706 (Replacment box to try to fix the issue)
Amazon order # for PRO X Pedals

112-3897005-0876247

Contact: Alyk Pliskie
Phone #:1-920-420-6952

Shipping Address:
Alyk Pliskie
2800 W Parkmmoor Court
Appleton, WI 54914

On Sun, Dec 28, 2025 at 10:14 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Alyk,  Please uninstall SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.2 from your computer first, then download and install SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.3 from our official website.  SIMSONN Manager 2.1.3 includes optimizations for the vibration function. Please test again using this version.  https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

Hi Alyk,  We have sent you a replacement master control box. The tracking number is SF6047230458817. The shipping carrier is SF Express. You can track it via https://www.sf-international.com/cn/en/support/querySupport/waybill.

Updated to the 2.1.3. It still gets stuck but, will stop vibrating by
itself after about 5 seconds, instead of me having to unplug it. Also
losing connection to the motors now randomly

On Thu, Jan 8, 2026 at 9:29 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Alyk,  Please try the new control box. It may help.
